trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Features in preview | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Features in preview | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic describes in more detail features which are in preview in Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes in more detail features which are in preview in Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: More details about features in preview
trans-unit.target: More details about features in preview

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to use features currently in preview.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to use features currently in preview.

trans-unit.source: User writeback
trans-unit.target: User writeback

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The user writeback preview feature was temporarily removed in the August update to AAD Connect.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The user writeback preview feature was temporarily removed in the August update to AAD Connect.

trans-unit.source: If you have enabled it, then you should disable this feature.
trans-unit.target: If you have enabled it, then you should disable this feature.

trans-unit.source: User writeback is in early preview.
trans-unit.target: User writeback is in early preview.

trans-unit.source: It can only be used when Azure AD is the source for all user objects and on-premises Active Directory is empty before you enable the feature.
trans-unit.target: It can only be used when Azure AD is the source for all user objects and on-premises Active Directory is empty before you enable the feature.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] This feature should only be tested in a test environment and should not be used in an Azure AD directory used for production usage.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] This feature should only be tested in a test environment and should not be used in an Azure AD directory used for production usage.

trans-unit.source: Group writeback
trans-unit.target: Group writeback

trans-unit.source: The option for group writeback in optional features will allow you to writeback “Office 365 Groups” to a forest with Exchange installed.
trans-unit.target: The option for group writeback in optional features will allow you to writeback “Office 365 Groups” to a forest with Exchange installed.

trans-unit.source: This is a new group type which is always mastered in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This is a new group type which is always mastered in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You can find this in outlook.office365.com or on myapps.microsoft.com as shown here:
trans-unit.target: You can find this in outlook.office365.com or on myapps.microsoft.com as shown here:

trans-unit.source: Sync Filtering
trans-unit.target: Sync Filtering

trans-unit.source: Sync Filtering
trans-unit.target: Sync Filtering

trans-unit.source: This group will be represented as a distribution group in on-premises AD DS.
trans-unit.target: This group will be represented as a distribution group in on-premises AD DS.

trans-unit.source: Your on-premises Exchange server must be on Exchange 2013 cumulative update 8 (released in March 2015) to recognize this new group type.
trans-unit.target: Your on-premises Exchange server must be on Exchange 2013 cumulative update 8 (released in March 2015) to recognize this new group type.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: The address book attribute is currently not populated in the preview.
trans-unit.target: The address book attribute is currently not populated in the preview.

trans-unit.source: The easiest way to do this is to use the Exchange PowerShell cmdlet update-recipient.
trans-unit.target: The easiest way to do this is to use the Exchange PowerShell cmdlet update-recipient.

trans-unit.source: Only forests with the Exchange schema are valid targets for groups.
trans-unit.target: Only forests with the Exchange schema are valid targets for groups.

trans-unit.source: If no Exchange was detected, then group writeback will not be possible to enable.
trans-unit.target: If no Exchange was detected, then group writeback will not be possible to enable.

trans-unit.source: The Group writeback feature does not currently handle security groups or distribution groups.
trans-unit.target: The Group writeback feature does not currently handle security groups or distribution groups.

trans-unit.source: More information about Office 365 Groups can be found [here](http://aka.ms/O365g).
trans-unit.target: More information about Office 365 Groups can be found [here](http://aka.ms/O365g).

trans-unit.source: Directory extensions
trans-unit.target: Directory extensions

trans-unit.source: Directory extensions allows you to extend the schema in Azure AD with your own attributes from on-premises Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Directory extensions allows you to extend the schema in Azure AD with your own attributes from on-premises Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Only single-valued attributes are supported and the values in the attributes cannot be longer than 250 characters.
trans-unit.target: Only single-valued attributes are supported and the values in the attributes cannot be longer than 250 characters.

trans-unit.source: The metaverse and Azure AD schema will be extended with the attributes selected.
trans-unit.target: The metaverse and Azure AD schema will be extended with the attributes selected.

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD a new application is added with the attributes.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD a new application is added with the attributes.

trans-unit.target: Sync Filtering

trans-unit.target: These attributes will now be available through Graph:

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Continue your [Custom installation of Azure AD Connect](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-custom.md).

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
